abstracts.cdata!:
The Power Sector Rehabilitation and
            Modernization Project for Romania had the following ratings:
            the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability was highly
            likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that
            restructuring the power sector is a time-consuming process.
            Romanian Energy Regulatory Agency's (ANRE's)
            evolution into a well functioning regulatory agency was very
            instrumental in supporting the reform of the sector.
            ANRE's staff, who are of high caliber and well
            respected in the profession, helped develop the broader
            consensus for resolving many sectoral issues, especially on
            tariffs. European union (EU) accession goal provided
            significant momentum to reforms in the power sector, and
            when the Bank's sector assistance to create the
            enabling framework is combined with macro and policy reforms
            supported by the Bank and/or IMF, the synergy can ensure
            better and timely results. A Least-cost study can be of
            considerable value without reference to the structure of the sector.
